paragraphs.text: Abstract
paragraphs.label: Abstract

paragraphs.text: Obstacles that often occur in cultivation of tomatoes, chilies, and tobacco is the occurrence of diseases caused by viruses. One of them is infected with the Cucumber mosaic virus (CMV), this virus infection is very dangerous for large red chili, tomato and tobacco farming which results in quite large losses for farmers in Indonesia. Controlling viral infections caused by CMV is very difficult due to the high genetic diversity of CMV making it difficult to obtain resistant types of red pepper, tomato and tobacco, the range of CMV host plants is wide, and CMV can be transmitted by aphids and ticks. non-persistent whiteheads. The aim of this journal review was to determine the pathogenicity of sat-RNA associated with CMV in red chilies, tomatoes and tobacco. Based on the results of reviews from several journals, it can be seen that RNA satellite is effective against CMV infection on chili, tomato, and tobacco plants. Which can be seen by administering the CARNA vaccine to each plant treatment.

paragraphs.text: 1. Introduction
paragraphs.label: Introduction

paragraphs.text: Cucumber mosaic virus (CMV) is a virus that infected chili and tomato. This infection can affect chili and tomato cultivations. Several control, such as insecticide, can be used in charge to control virus infections. It can help reduce the number of attack vectors that are considered ineffective and harms the environment and residues in crop yields (Ernawati et al., 2021).
paragraphs.label: Unknown

paragraphs.text: CMV infections that occur are not only in chili and tomato plants but also infected tobacco plants. It can cause enormous losses to tobacco farmers. So that this virus infection is hazardous for chili, tomato, and tobacco farming which results in immense losses for farmers in Indonesia (Mochizuki et al. 2014).
paragraphs.label: Results and Discussion

paragraphs.text: Improper or substandard handling practices can make chilies, tomatoes, and tobacco susceptible to viruses resulting in maximized yields, low marketability, or crop failure. Large red chilies, tomatoes, and tobacco were often attacked by parasitic animals, namely caterpillars, armyworms, aphids, whiteflies, whiteflies, thrips, mites, and fruit flies which can cause disease in large red chilies, tomatoes, and tobacco (Fitriani and Febrianto, 2020). Control of CMV virus infection is challenging due to the diverse genetic diversity of CMV and difficulty obtaining the resistant types of large red chilies, tomatoes, and tobacco, wide distribution of host plants, and CMV is easily transmitted non-persistently by vectors of whitefly and aphids (Martin et al. al., 1997).
paragraphs.label: Unknown

paragraphs.text: Cross-protection protection is applied to plants in plantations, and tomato, papaya, chili, citrus, and tobacco farming. Furthermore, it has been proven to control the viruses that attack them. Plant protection utilizes the weakest virus strain as a guard agent against harmful virus infections (Aranda et al., 1995). Viruses selected from the field are an effective control and are not harmful to the environment. It happens because of the adjustment and production of strain according to the existing environment. Control using this technique does not generate new mutations of viruses that can interact with viruses already in the field so that they do not cause plant-destroying diseases.
paragraphs.label: Unknown

paragraphs.text: Based on these problems, virus infection control is a biological control using sat-RNA. This journal review aims to determine the pathogenicity of the association between sat-RNA and CMV in chilies, tomatoes, and tobaccos.

paragraphs.text: 2. Results and Discussion
paragraphs.label: Results and Discussion

paragraphs.text: This study found that CMV sat-RNA in chili peppers was less pathogenic than the dangerous CMV-G strain. It can be seen from the existing observation variable, the height, length, number of fruits, and weight of the chilies have changed. CMV sat-RNA that attacked both in quantity and quality did not decrease. This is shown in the weight and length of the fruit adjacent to the plant without treatment (control). Inversely proportional to infection with the CMV-G strain that infects chilies reduces the number and quality of fruit. as shown in Table 1.
paragraphs.label: Unknown

paragraphs.text: This study shows that CMV-sat RNA having the potential to be a virulent biological control agent against CMV strains. This ability showed no difference in the impact of CMV-satRNA infecting plants without treatment (control) on the reproductive and vegetative growth observation variables of chilies, as shown in Table 1. Use of CMV sat-RNA in CMV control.

paragraphs.label: Results and Discussion

paragraphs.text: The results of this research showed that tomatoes protect against malignant strains at the initial observation (2 weeks) after the inoculation day. Tomato protection against malignant strains has shown by the height of the tomato stem, where tomatoes given the vaccination (CARNA 5.2) did not show high growth retardation (same as tomatoes without treatment). This was shown by the CARNA 5.2 vaccinated tomatoes, where CMV malignant strains were not inoculated, in contrast to the CARNA 5.1 vaccinated plants which did not inhibit growth in height, as shown in Figure 1.
paragraphs.label: Results and Discussion

paragraphs.text: Plants that were protected by CARNA 5.2 and CARNA 5.1 had higher fruit weights than tomatoes without vaccine protection. Therefore, CARNA 5.2 and CARNA 5.1 prevented CMV infection and were quite effective in protecting tomatoes.

paragraphs.text: The CARNA 5.1, and CARNA 5.2 vaccines, protect tomatoes against the virulent CMV-G strain. It shows that the tomatoes that have already been vaccinated were higher than those that have not been vaccinated. Even though the severity of the virus infection was relatively high in the vaccinated plants, it produced heavier fruit weights than plants infected with malignant strains.
paragraphs.label: Unknown

paragraphs.text: The severity of CMV infection also occurred in tobacco plants that were inducted with the CARNA-5 vaccine, which was significantly different from plants that were not vaccinated. The severity of infection on tobacco has a significant difference. Plants that were vaccinated with CARNA-5 (D3; D4; D5; and D6) had a severity of 8.33 - 10.83%, while those that were not applied with the vaccine (D1 and D2) had a higher severity, reaching 18.33-20.33%. The data is presented in Table 2. However, elevated infection damage in tobacco has been inducted with the CARNA-5 vaccine at the lowest concentration of 5%, namely 1.3 %/day. Then tobacco without being vaccinated reached 0.95 %/day. In tobacco given 10% CARNA-5 vaccinations, but not inoculated and CMV inoculated, the development of viral infection was 0.5%/day and 0.86-0.89%/day.

paragraphs.text: 4. Conclusions
paragraphs.label: Conclusions

paragraphs.text: From the results of the journal review above, it can be concluded that infection with CMV containing satellite RNA in chili plants does not reduce the quantity and quality of crop yields. In tomato plants, the CARNA 5.1 and CARNA 5.2 vaccines were effective in protecting tomatoes from CMV infection as indicated by low disease severity, the same plant height as healthy plants, and higher tomato yields. Whereas in tobacco the CARNA 5 vaccine at all concentrations (5%, 10%, and 15%) can reduce the incidence and severity of diseases.
